attributes.action: Petition for David Cameron to be the first boots on the ground in line of fire.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop arming and funding the aggressors, denounce all allies that do. Prevent people joining Daesh. Solve the problems that leave them feeling they have no other option. People join Daesh for many reasons, one is that they feel persecuted and that Daesh offers a 'utopian caliphate'. Military action only fuels this. 

http://www.quilliamfoundation.org/wp/wp-content/uploads/publications/free/the-virtual-caliphate-understanding-islamic-states-propaganda-strategy.pdf

^The qf website is great^
attributes.background:
David Cameron should have his boots on the ground and be first in the line of fire if he proceeds with military action in Syria.
There is increasing evidence that by bombing in Syria we are playing into the hands of Daesh forces. Instead there needs to be political negotiations and settlement.

rejection.details: This would be an individual decision for the Prime Minister, not the responsibility of Parliament as a whole.
